source.name: Jail Population Outside New York City Average Daily Census: Beginning  1997
source.description:
64 county jails outside New York City submit daily counts of their populations through the Jails Daily Population Reporting system (JDPRS) to the State Commission of Correction.  The JDPRS is accessed through the eJusticeNY Integrated Justice Portal, a secure website for law enforcement.  Through a collaborative effort with the State Commission of Corrections (SCOC), DCJS developed an annual jail population report which shows each jail’s average daily census for each year.  Daily counts are averaged and then divided by the number of days reported for that year. Since the daily population can fluctuate, this method ensures that the census counts shown for the year represent the true average for that year.  The counts submitted through JDPRS are categorized by type of offender and include Sentenced, Civil, Federal, Technical Parole Violators, State Readies and Other Unsentenced.   These jail population reports provide local officials with information on historical trends within their jurisdictions and possible population trends impacting the jail census.
NOTE:  All figures represent an average daily census.
